conclusion: Determine the induced emf
Only the right-hand half of the square (width 0.10 m, height 0.20 m) is in the field
Area in field is A = 0.10 m × 0.20 m = 2.0 × 10⁻² m²
Magnetic flux through that half: Φ = B A
Because B varies with time, the magnitude of the induced emf is |ε| = |dΦ/dt| = A · |dB/dt|
Current in the frame
Current direction (Lenz’s law)
B is increasing into the page; the induced current must produce a field out of the page (to oppose the increase)
Using the right-hand rule, that requires a counter-clockwise current in the loop when viewed from the front (the side shown)
Magnetic force on each section
Only the two vertical sides experience net horizontal forces, but the left vertical side is outside the field
Only the right vertical side (length = 0.20 m) feels a force
Magnitude: F = I L B
Direction: Current in the right side flows upward (part of the counter-clockwise loop)
By Fleming’s left-hand rule (or right-hand rule for force), with current upward and field into the page, the force is toward the left
Frictional force required for equilibrium
The frame is said to remain stationary, so the horizontal magnetic force must be balanced by static friction of equal magnitude acting toward the right
